title: If You Held Your Bitcoin and Ethereum After FTX Crash, It's Cryptomas! - Bloomberg
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

"Bitcoin and Ethereum prices surge, up 167% and 91% respectively since Jan 2023. Crypto rally outperforms other asset classes, including NASDAQ, S&P 500, and gold. Last year, many expected crypto to decline, but it has instead delivered impressive returns."

title: Ethereum's Price Edges Toward $2,500: Surge or Mirage Ahead? - U.Today
summary: Ethereum's price is approaching $2,500, but the decentralized finance (DeFi) sector is struggling due to high transaction fees. Ethereum cofounder Vitalik Buterin has proposed integrating zero-knowledge scaling solutions to improve usability. Competitors like Solana have lower fees and higher transaction throughput, putting pressure on Ethereum to enhance its scalability and efficiency. The chart shows a notable uptrend, but resistance at $2,500 could limit gains. The meme coin BONK has seen a meteoric rise in valuation and listings on major exchanges, but its potential for sustained growth is uncertain due to the volatile nature of meme coins.

title: Ethereum price prediction as 3 out of 4 ETH holders are in profit; Time to buy? - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary: Ethereum price has surged 85% in the past year, with 76% of holders now in profit. However, 23% of wallets are holding a losing position, and 1% acquired the token at current prices. Despite this, the low concentration of whales and institutional investors reduces the risk of huge sell-offs. The future developments and growth of the DeFi ecosystem on Ethereum could generate more demand for the token, driving up prices. However, investing in such a volatile market carries risks, and investors must be aware of the potential downsides.

title: Ethereum's Dencun Upgrade: ETH Developers Reveal Major Milestone as 2023 Bows Out - U.Today
summary: Ethereum developers have announced a key milestone in the development of the Dencun upgrade, which aims to improve the network's scalability. The upgrade will include changes to both the execution layer (Cancun) and the consensus layer (Deneb). Developers are on track to launch a Goerli shadow fork testing the upgrade within the next two weeks, with all client combinations, including Prysm, onboarded to Devnet 12. The upgrade is expected to tackle Ethereum's scalability challenges and is the last one scheduled for the network.

title: Dormant Ethereum Whale Continues to Sell ETH Holdings: Details - U.Today
summary: A dormant Ethereum whale has resumed selling its holdings after a year-long hiatus, offloading 18,865 ETH worth $42 million through four new wallets. The average selling price was $2,229. The whale now has 5,588 ETH worth $12.5 million remaining. Meanwhile, other Ethereum whales have been accumulating, with some buying over 100,000 ETH worth $230 million in the last week. Ethereum (ETH) price is down 1.33% in the last 24 hours, trading in a crucial zone between $2,216 and $2,302. Fees have remained high this week, affecting supply, with approximately 35,000 ETH burned in the last seven days.
